User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

I created a Web page that links to http://www.pitt.edu/~poole/Office2010frame.html. When I click on the link, I get a File Not Found error. If I click next to the URL and hit Enter, the page loads just fine. I discovered that the ~ is coded with %7E (that's what my Web creation tool does automatically). If I use a text editor to change it to ~ it works fine. This only happens in Firefox (both Mac and Windows). It works fine with the %7E in IE and Google Chrome.


Actual results:

File Not Found error


Expected results:

The page should load.
comments.author: marco@loyola.edu

comments.text:
The URL http://www.pitt.edu/%7Epoole/Office2010frame.html is a 404 and you specified this URL in your link.

The URL bar however always decodes URLs for a better readability. Gecko on the other side encodes only those characters that needs be be encoded.
A tilde is an unreserved character and is allowed in an URL and will not be percent-encoded.
http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt section2.3

There is no problem with a space in a URL because a space have to be always percent-encoded. "http://example.com/test a/index.html" is no valid URL and will be encoded to "http://example.com/test%20a/index.html"

I don't see why this should be a valid bug in Gecko. This looks like a server bug because the server should decode the percent-encoded URL and it fails to do that.
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de

comments.text:
This bug also affects Thunderbird. A mail containing an URL for a password reset containing a long set of characters including tilde, get urlencoded, where the tilde gets truncated into %7F - this is not compliant with RFC 3986, where the tilde is considered an unreserved character (in contrary to RFC 1738 where it was considered an unsafe character. RFC 3986 updates RFC 1738) A webmail client in Firefox handles this correctly. Thunderbird alters this code. Here is the raw code (URL anonymized):

Click here to change password.

When doing "copy link location" or clicking on the link, this is the URL I'm going to: https://login.mysite.com/resetpassword?apiKey=3_uZ_352kFc15JjwSz7LYCUjlNXIQgedeWCRwMwXNCAjwIIQoZRfJ0rfEBG6Ta14C1&pwrt=PR1_stDafD%7E02045353544b0736363533303031015b0f%7EQEZY2PMk0EzLtcKIHZEvcruZ5Il6fYLvnxi2kJcl35eqUZ6Akw7VsAE2Yd5qa32rpPXKRahZ4X2xYLADHDVodtkQtsax837ZCeS_obGGf629aQ%7E
